label: Behavior 03984091
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: navigating along a fixed route (the persistent alignment between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and negligible course deviation, indicates the vessel is following a straight, predefined maritime route; the position progression follows a linear trajectory moving west-southwest, approximated by the parametric equations: lat(t) ≈ 55.6066 - 0.0105 × t, lon(t) ≈ 7.3809 - 0.0052 × t, where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed between 11.0 and 11.4 knots throughout the observed segment)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG varies slightly between 175.9° and 199.3°, showing a slow, continuous adjustment over time rather than abrupt changes)
Heading fluctuation: gradual and consistent (heading remains close to 196°, with only minor deviations down to 181° and 179° in later points, indicating controlled rudder adjustments)

Behavior intent: navigating along a fixed route (the persistent alignment between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and negligible course deviation, indicates the vessel is following a straight, predefined maritime route; the position progression follows a linear trajectory moving west-southwest, approximated by the parametric equations: lat(t) ≈ 55.6066 - 0.0105 × t, lon(t) ≈ 7.3809 - 0.0052 × t, where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
